channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 4 Types of New Laws and Regulations Business Owners Need to Know in 2026
item.description: Entrepreneurs have witnessed dizzying regulatory changes at the national level in 2025. Now they need to prepare for new laws going into effect tomorr...

item.title: Why this flu season is spiraling faster than anyone expected
item.description: Flu season is here and it’s shaping up to be a bad one. Cases of the flu are rising sharply across the country – and that’s when looking at data colle...

item.title: U.S. drug prices to rise for 350 medications in 2026
item.description: Drugmakers plan to raise U.S. prices on at least 350 branded medications including vaccines against COVID, RSV and shingles and blockbuster cancer tre...

item.title: How a USPS rule change could impact election ballots in 2026
item.description: It’s the sort of thing you might not notice until it really matters, but the U.S. Postal Service recently changed how it defines the “postmark” on a p...

item.title: China buys two-thirds of pledged U.S. soybeans as 2025 closes
item.description: The return of Chinese buyers is welcome news for U.S. exporters, and a reminder that buying patterns can change fast — but it is not yet a full reset.

item.title: How to Make an RTO Plan Your Employees Won’t Hate
item.description: Microshifting, where staff work in concentrated bursts, is just one way to deal with shifting workday patterns.

item.title: Dollar set for worst year since 2017 with Fed drama center stage
item.description: “The biggest factor for the dollar in first quarter will be the Fed,” said Yusuke Miyairi, a foreign-exchange strategist at Nomura.

item.title: CMOs Reveal the Top Marketing Trends That Will Dominate 2026
item.description: That marketing executives behind some of the fastest-growing consumer brands make their predictions.

item.title: China’s factory activity rebounds in December after an 8-month slump

item.title: Canadian stocks set record for records in ‘jaw-dropping’ year
item.description: “The numbers themselves are somewhat jaw dropping,” said IG Wealth Management chief investment strategist Philip Petursson by phone.

item.title: How FOMO Is Turning AI Into a Cybersecurity Nightmare
item.description: Every CEO I meet thinks their AI strategy is simple: implement tools, boost productivity, and stay competitive. The reality is far riskier.

item.title: Gold and silver stumble at the end of best year since the 1970s
item.description: “In my career, it’s unprecedented,” said John Reade, a market veteran and chief strategist at the World Gold Council.

item.title: This New Feature on LG’s TVs Has Been Driving Some Owners Crazy
item.description: The company is backtracking after seeing frustration from customers.
